conclusion: Analyze velocity-time graphs to determine acceleration trend of object B.
Velocity-time graph for object A is a straight line with constant velocity; object B's graph is a parabola.
Identify object B's graph as a parabola.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
From \(t = 0\) to \(t = t_1\), positive slope indicates increasing velocity and positive acceleration.
From \(t = t_1\) to \(t = t_2\), negative slope indicates decreasing velocity and negative acceleration.
Acceleration of object B changes from positive to negative during \(t = 0\) to \(t_2\).
